page.title: 08SCOTNEY CASTLE OFFICES
page.content: The regional headquarters of the National Trust for the South-East of England are at Scotney Castle. The National Trust started in 1895 to look after old houses and beautiful countryside. Mr. Kingston is the regional director. Mr. Evans is one of the two accountants. There is also a Land Agent, an Architect, an Artist, an Antiques Advisor a Publicity Officer and several Secretaries. The offices are in a converted barn where wagons were stored. There is a lot of equipment, including a computer. People come from all over the world to help the National Trust. They stay at Acorn Camp, an old house in the woods. Working with the wardens they make up footpath signs and clear parts of the woods.
